com.herocraftonline.heroes.characters.skill

Class Skill

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.herocraftonline.heroes.command.BasicCommand
      • com.herocraftonline.heroes.characters.skill.Skill
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActiveSkill, OutsourcedSkill, PassiveSkill

    public abstract class Skill
extends BasicCommand
    The root class of the skill heirarchy. This class implements the basic functionality of every Heroes skill including configuration handling, area-based player notifications and event registration. Because this class extends com.herocraftonline.dev.heroes.command.BaseCommand, the constructor of every skill should define a name, description, usage, min and max arguments and at least one identifier. Any registered events must provide an event listener, usually created as an inner class.

    Skill Framework:
    • ActiveSkill
      • TargettedSkill
    • PassiveSkill
    • OutsourcedSkill
    Note: All skill identifiers must begin with skill, e.g. "skill fireball".

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(org.bukkit.Location source,
             String message,
             Object... args)
        Helper method that broadcasts a message to all players within 30 blocks of the specified source. These messages can be suppressed by players on an individual basis.
        Parameters:
        source - the Location to measure from
        message - the content of the message
        args - any text in the message of the format $n where n is an integer will be replaced with the nth element of this array

      • damageCheck

        public static boolean damageCheck(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                  org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity target)
        Tests if the target is damagable from a source. Also adds a last-damage cause to the target which allows proper xp. Returns if the damage check was successful.
        Parameters:
        player -
        target -
        Returns:

      • execute

        public abstract boolean execute(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
              String identifier,
              String[] args)
        The end of the execution path of a skill, this method is called whenever a command with a registered identifier is used.
        Parameters:
        sender - the CommandSender issuing the command
        args - the arguments provided with the command

      • getDefaultConfig

        public org.bukkit.configuration.ConfigurationSection getDefaultConfig()

        Returns:
        an empty configuration
